title: Make the sign-in (login) screen the default first page and show “Welcome to EOA”

requirements.text: Make the login/sign-in screen the first (default) screen users see by changing the `/` (index) route to render a dedicated sign-in page instead of the current Home/Landing page.

quotes: I want the login page where you log in to be first and it says welcome to eoa

acceptanceCriteria: When a user visits `/`, the app shows a sign-in page (not the current Home/Landing page).
All other existing routes (e.g., `/trip-builder`, `/saved`, `/memory-finder`, `/groups`, `/profile`) remain unchanged and reachable via navigation or direct URL.

requirements.text: Ensure the default sign-in page shown at `/` displays the exact heading text "Welcome to EOA" (English text, exact casing) and includes a working Sign In button that initiates Internet Identity login; after a successful login, redirect the user to `/profile`.

quotes: I want the login page where you log in to be first and it says welcome to eoa

acceptanceCriteria: The sign-in page at `/` visibly displays the heading text exactly: "Welcome to EOA".
No extra or garbled characters appear in the welcome heading text.
Clicking "Sign In" on the `/` page initiates Internet Identity login.
After a successful login from the `/` page, the user is navigated to `/profile`.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI component sources).
nonGoals: Do not change backend canister logic or data models.
Do not change existing route paths/URLs besides making `/` show the sign-in page.
Do not redesign unrelated pages (Trip Builder, Results, Saved, Memory Finder, Groups, Profile) beyond what is necessary to support the new default landing behavior.
